channel.title: markets on PepsFeeder
channel.description: Recent content in markets on PepsFeeder

item.title: Seven questions about negative oil prices
item.description: While Ukrainians rested after the celebration of Easter, the world collapsed in the oil markets. First, on Black Monday, oil collapsed to zero, and then buyers of American oil were paid extra for taking it.

item.title: South Korean officials: There is no indication that Kim Jong-un is experiencing physical problems
item.description: According to a media report on Tuesday (April 21), North Korean leader Kim Jong-un was seriously ill, leading to a sharp depreciation of South Korean currency and the South Korean stock market.

item.title: Markets want Fed to save them. Why its tools might not work.
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — As stocks at some level of the arena tumble on worries about a swiftly-spreading virus, investors were clamoring for the superheroes of the financial world to stride to the rescue yet again.

item.title: The US-China trade deal has cooled down before the storm
item.description: The markets breathed a sigh of relief after the signing of the “first phase” agreement between Washington and Beijing last Wednesday. But this deal is only a truce in a battle that is likely to resume after the November elections.
